## Shopify API

This workflow uses GraphQL calls to the Shopify Admin API. In order to get a better understanding for the queries and mutations please check the API Docs.


[Shopify GraphQL API docs]({{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}

To make it easy to build queries for the GraphQL API easy please check out the [GraphiQL App for the Admin API]({{ $env.API_BASE_URL }} from Shopify

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Shopify order UTM to Baserow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Shopify order UTM to Baserow. This workflow integrates 8 different services: stickyNote, scheduleTrigger, graphql, splitOut, set. It contains 12 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 12
- **Node Types**: 8
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Baserow**: baserow
- **No Operation, do nothing**: noOp
- **Set Shopify Subdomain**: set
- **Get orders from Shopify**: graphql
- **Every day at 00:00**: scheduleTrigger
- **Split Shopify data into n8n items**: splitOut
- **Transform incoming data structure**: set
- **Check if "Campaign" is present**: if
- **Sticky Note4**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- ... and 2 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
